intro: Smilax regelii var. albida, commonly known as the white smilax, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its stout, thorny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in spadices, followed by bright red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
